definition: to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: Tom was upsetting the other children, so I showed him the door。
sentences.chinese: 汤姆一直在扰乱别的孩子，我就把他撵了出去。

sentences.english: Years so rumbled out live another life in the slice.
sentences.chinese: 岁月就这么轰隆隆撵过一个又一个生命中的切片。

sentences.english: They bundled him off to the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们匆匆把他撵到乡下去了。

sentences.english: The owner kicked them out of the restaurant for being loud and disorderly.
sentences.chinese: 他们又吵又闹，餐馆的主人把他们撵了出去。

sentences.english: The drunkard was turned from the bar.
sentences.chinese: 那个醉汉被从酒吧撵了出去。
他们把那个醉汉撵了出去。

sentences.english: She bundled him off to the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 她匆匆把他撵到乡下去。

sentences.english: The audience shouted down the unpopular actress off the stage.
sentences.chinese: 观众大喝倒彩，将那位不受欢迎的演员撵下了舞台。

sentences.english: They chucked the stranger out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他们把这个陌生人从房间里撵了出去。

sentences.english: The sheepdog rounded up the sheep and drove them through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊犬把羊撵到了一起，把它们赶过栅门。

definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
to vanish/to be nowhere to be found/unfounded (story)
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
to run around all over the place
